description.narrative: The objective of the Disease Prevention and Control Project for Armenia is to improve: (i) Maternal and Child Health (MCH) services and the prevention, early detection, and management of selected Non-Communicable Diseases (NCD) at the Primary Health Care (PHC) level; and (ii) the efficiency and quality of selected hospitals in Armenia. The changes aim at reallocating an amount of US$8.1 million that became available as a consequence of the mis-procurement without cancellation declared in September, 2014, and related to the Vanadzor Medical Center (MC) civil works. The restructuring includes: (a) modifications of the Project results framework consisting of revision of some Project Development Objective (PDO) indicators and intermediate results indicators, including baseline and target values; (b) revision of activities in component one ‘Performance-Based Financing (PBF)’ and sub-component 2.1 of component two ‘improving efficiency and quality of selected hospitals’, respectively; and (c) revision of certain legal covenants related to the PBF component.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Project Steering Committee (SC) established and maintained | Description :The Recipient, no later than 30 daysafter Effectiveness Date, shall create and thereafter maintain: the SC consisting of the representatives of the MoH and other keystakeholders, with the responsibility of guiding and coordinating the implementation of the Program, defining TOR, participating intechnical evaluations and working directly with consultants on arrangements of strategic TA. | Due Date :15-Aug-2013

Finance Agreement :PHC Coordinating Committee established and maintained | Description :The Recipient, no later than 30 days afterthe Effectiveness Date, shall create and thereafter maintain a PHC Coordinating Committee, with membership and compositionacceptable to the Associations, including representatives of the relevant MOH departments and units, SHA and the HPIU, with theresponsibility of supervise and guide the implementation of PBF Scheme. | Due Date :15-Aug-2013

Finance Agreement :PHC Performance Agreements entered | Description :The Recipient shall enter into an agreement with each of theEligible PHC facilities (“PHC Performance Agreements”), under terms and conditions approved by the Association and elaborated inthe PBF Manual, setting forth the technical, administrative and fiduciaryaspects of their participation in the implementation anduse of funds under Part 1(a) of the Project. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Health Project Implementation Unit (HPIU) maintained | Description :The Recipient shall operate and maintain,until the completion of the Project, an implementation unit within MOH, to be responsiblefor the overall coordination of theProject (the “HPIU”). Such unit shall have staff in adequate numbers and with qualifications andexperience satisfactory to theAssociation. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Project Operational Manual (POM) | Description :The Recipient, not later than 30 days after the EffectivenessDate, shall have executed the Co-financing Agreement and all conditions precedent to its effectiveness or to the right of theRecipient to make withdrawals under it have been fulfilled. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Performance-based Financing Manual (PBFM) | Description :The Recipient shall carry out the Project in accordancewith the Performance-Based Financing (PBF) Manual dated February 12, 2013. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Verification Working Group Reports furnished to the Association | Description :The Recipient shall furnish tothe SHA and the Association as soon as available, the reports of the Verification Working Group referred to in paragraph (b) above| Due Date :30-Jun-2015

Finance Agreement :Verification Working Group established | Description :The Recipient shall as soon as possible after theEffective Date, established a Verification Working Group conformed by members with experience and qualifications in the health andsocial sectors acceptable to the Association, pursuant to the provisions of Section III of this Schedule and in accordance withterms of reference satisfactory to the Association, for the carrying out of technical review | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Verification Working Group verification done semi-annually | Description :The Recipient shall cause theVerification Working Group to carry out the verification of quantity and quality of primary care services prior to the release ofthe PBF payments on a semi-annual basis, and in accordance with the criteria set forth in the PBF Manual; and thereafter prepare areport of such scope and in such details the Association shall reasonably request. | Frequency :SemiAnnual

title.narrative: Percentage of antenatal care (ANC) attendees screened for glycosuria, hypertension and proteinuria in at least three antenatal visits
Bed occupancy rate at the a) Artashat Medical Center; b) Sevan Medical Center
Number of designated intensive care units that are fully equipped and functional, without stock-outs in preceding two weeks
Percentage of population aged 35-68 screened for hypertension at least once in the last year a) female; b) male
Percentage of population aged 35-68 screened for diabetes mellitus at PHC level at least once during the last 3 years a) female; b)male
Percentage of women aged 30-60 screened for cervical cancer at least once during the last 3 years and received the results
Proportion of PHC facilities undergoing enhanced verification of results by the HPIU
Health facilities constructed, renovated, and/or equipped (number)
The number of ventilators for management of COVID-19 cases, financed through the Project
Level of awareness among adults in key NCD risk factors a) high blood pressure; b) high cholesterol level; c) high salt intake; d) obesity; e) high glucose level (disaggregated by gender)
Number of hospital health workers receiving training in a set of new clinical practice guidelines
Medical Centers operational a) Sevan MC; b) Artashat MC; c) Martuni MC

actual.value: a) Operational.b) Operational.c) Civil works started.
